Question: This person (January 17, 1706 [O.S January 6, 1705] – April 17, 1790) was one of the Founding Fathers of the United States.
Hints: Wisdom in folk society meant the ability to provide an apt adage for any occasion, and this person's readers became well prepared.
This person became involved in Philadelphia politics and rapidly progressed.
According to David Morgan, this person was a proponent of religion in general.
